H0.text: Excretion is the process by which large and complex molecules in living things are broken down into small and simple molecules.

H1.text: Absorption is the process in living things by which large and complex molecules are broken down into small and simple molecules.

H2.text: Digestion is the process by which large and complex molecules are broken down into small and simple molecules in living things.

H3.text: Circulation is the process in living things in which large and complex molecules are broken down into small and simple molecules.

A4.text: Digestion is the breakdown of large insoluble food compounds into small water-soluble components so that they can be absorbed into the blood plasma.

A5.text: Absorption: of nutrients from the digestive system to the circulatory and lymphatic capillaries through osmosis, active transport, and diffusion.
